passage_text: The capillary wall is made up of a single layer of endothelium lying on a delicate basement membrane … . The thin capillary wall enables water and dissolved substances, including oxygen, to diffuse from the blood into the tissue spaces, where they become available for use by the cells.

The rate at which the glomerulus produces filtrate from plasma (the glomerular filtration rate) is much higher than in systemic capillaries because of the particular anatomical characteristics of the glomerulus.

Approximately 178.5 L of the 180 L of filtrate produced every day is reabsorbed (99.2% of filtrate is reabsorbed). Urine output is about 1.5 L per day but can fall to conserve water (400 mL/day) or increase dramatically to rid the body of excess water.

The capillary also allows waste from the metabolizing cell to diffuse from the tissue spaces into the capillaries for transport by the blood to the organs of excretion.
